3.title: Check in with {firstName}
3.body: Sleep has been shorter than usual for 3 days.

7.title: Check in with {firstName} this week
7.body: A full week of shorter sleep. Ask about stress, routine, or discomfort.

14.title: {firstName} might need extra support
14.body: Two weeks of shorter sleep. Consider a simple plan: earlier bedtime, less screen time, and a gentle check-in.

21.title: Time to check in today
21.body: Three weeks of shorter sleep. A direct check-in (and, if relevant, a clinician conversation) may help.

3.title: Check in with {firstName}
3.body: Movement has been lower than usual for 3 days.

7.title: Check in with {firstName} this week
7.body: A full week of lower movement. Ask if anything changed (routine, pain, illness, motivation).

14.title: {firstName} might need extra support
14.body: Two weeks of lower movement. Consider a small plan: short walks, lighter goals, and accountability.

21.title: Time to check in today
21.body: Three weeks of low movement. A direct check-in may help uncover what's getting in the way.

3.title: Check in with {firstName}
3.body: Stress indicators look higher than usual for 3 days (HRV is lower than their normal).

7.title: Check in with {firstName} this week
7.body: A full week of higher stress indicators. This can be associated with stress, illness, poor sleep, alcohol, or dehydration.

14.title: {firstName} might need extra support
14.body: Two weeks of persistent stress indicators. Consider a small plan: sleep routine, hydration, and lighter days.

21.title: Time to check in today
21.body: Three weeks of persistent stress indicators. Consider a direct check-in and, if relevant, a clinician conversation.

3.title: Check in with {firstName}
3.body: Resting heart rate has been higher than usual for 3 days.

7.title: Check in with {firstName} this week
7.body: A full week of higher resting heart rate. This can be associated with stress, illness, poor sleep, or dehydration.

14.title: {firstName} might need extra support
14.body: Two weeks of higher resting heart rate. Consider checking contributing factors and monitoring how they feel.

21.title: Time to check in today
21.body: Three weeks of higher resting heart rate. Consider a direct check-in and, if relevant, a clinician conversation.
